properties.name: Beauty Bar
properties.description: Posted by H3athrow231 E 14th St, New York, NY 10003Fun bar with awesome decor. You can also get your nails done there.

properties.name: Coliseum Books
properties.description: Posted by H3athrow 11 West 42nd Street, New York, NY 10036Great, focused newsstand. Awesome local book selection. And a cafe. Once of my favorite bookstores in New York.

properties.name: Fresco Tortillas
properties.description: Posted by H3athrow 620 Manhattan Ave., Brooklyn, NYSmall, two-table tortilla shop. Cheap eats.

properties.name: Labyrinth Books
properties.description: Posted by H3athrow536 West 112th Street, New York, NY 10025Smart, smart independent bookstore for bookish liberal types with an eye for design. Awesome little magazine (journal) selection. Very focused new title displays. A must go.

properties.name: McSorley's Old Ale House
properties.description: Posted by H3athrow15 East 7th Street New York, NY 10003Open since the 1860s, this is the oldest continually operating bar in New York City. There\'s sawdust on the floor and only two kinds of beer: light and dark. Orders come in two glasses. When it\'s crowded, it can be a hassle, but when it\'s not, it\'s an awesome way to soak up some of the city\'s liquid history.

properties.name: Pizza Prince
properties.description: Posted by H3athrow 84 Nassau Ave., Brooklyn, NYMy favorite local pizzeria. Two slices make a nice, inexpensive meal, and the folks working there are great.

properties.name: Posman Books
properties.description: Posted by H3athrow9 Grand Central Terminal, New York, NY 10017This small, independent bookstore in Grand Central is extremely convenient -- and a tempting stop on my daily commute. A small, but smart selection.

properties.name: Rodeo Bar & Grill 27th St.
properties.description: Posted by H3athrow 375 3rd Avenue, New York, NY, 10016Rodeo Bar & Grill 27th St. 212-683-6500

properties.name: Sound Fix
properties.description: Posted by H3athrow  110 Bedford Ave., Brooklyn, NYOn the pricey side, and the staff can be a little standoffish, but this record shop has an awesome selection of new, modern music. The kind of place you can walk in, say, "I want to introduce my friend to Calvin Johnson\'s music. Which record is a good start?" and walk out happy.

properties.name: St Marks Bookshop
properties.description: Posted by H3athrow31 3rd Avenue, New York, NY, 10003St Marks Bookshop 212212-260598-78534950

properties.name: Strand Bookstore
properties.description: Posted by Annaleen828 Broadway, New York, NYBest used bookstore in Manhattan.

properties.name: The Abbey
properties.description: Posted by H3athrow536 Driggs Ave., Brooklyn, NYCozy, friendly local bar slightly off the beaten path so it\'s not as hipster crazy. Really nice bartenders, and they occasionally show movies on weekends.

properties.name: The Palace
properties.description: Posted by H3athrow206 Nassau Ave., Brooklyn, NYOld-school, neighborhood bar that\'s a holdover from Greenpoint\'s Irish past. Run by two generations of the same family, which lives upstairs. Heavy metal jukebox and the occasional rock show in the back room, which used to be an active restaurant. Cheap beer.
